segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to another podcast here with us at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到我们的英语播客。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we're bringing you another part of our sports series.
segments.cn: 今天我们将为您带来体育系列的另一部分。

segments.en: And this time it's an advanced lesson.
That's right, we're heading to the mountains today to take a skiing lesson.
segments.cn: 没错，今天我们要去山上上滑雪课。

segments.en: Alright, so we're going to be learning about skiing, a winter sport and very popular throughout the world.
segments.cn: 好的，我们将学习滑雪，这是一项冬季运动，在世界各地都很受欢迎。

segments.en: So before we get started, why don't we take a look at a couple of words in vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 在开始之前，我们先来看几个词汇预览。

segments.en: Alright, so we're going to hear these two words in our dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，我们将在对话中听到这两个词。

segments.en: The first one is fresh powder.
Fresh powder.
Fresh powder.
Okay, so powder, we probably know this phrase already.
segments.cn: 好的，粉雪，我们可能已经知道这个短语了。

segments.en: Yep, but here we're talking about fresh light snow.
segments.cn: 是的，但这里我们说的是新鲜的轻雪。

segments.en: So fresh light snow, snow that recently fell.
segments.cn: 所以新鲜轻雪，就是最近下的雪。

segments.en: Yep.
Okay, so it looks like powder.
The best kind for skiing on.
Okay, the best kind.
Alright, so fresh powder.
What about our next phrase?
Well, we're also going to meet a four-time giant slalom champion.
segments.cn: 我们还将见到一位四届巨人回转冠军。

segments.en: Alright, a four-time giant slalom champion.
segments.cn: 好的，四届巨人回转冠军。

segments.en: Okay, so giant slalom is a type of ski race.
segments.cn: 好的，巨人回转是一种滑雪比赛。

segments.en: You probably see it on TV when they go down the hill and they have to go through these red or blue flags, right?
segments.cn: 你可能在电视上看到过，他们下山时必须通过这些红色或蓝色的旗帜，对吧？

segments.en: Yep.
Now a four-time giant slalom champion means he won the giant slalom four times.
segments.cn: 现在四届巨人回转冠军意味着他赢得了四次巨人回转。

segments.en: Okay, so this is an interesting way of saying that somebody did something many times.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一种有趣的说法，表示某人做了很多次。

segments.en: Right.
So I can say the three-time Nobel Prize winner.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说三届诺贝尔奖得主。

segments.en: Yes, exactly.
Okay.
Or the five-time Olympic gold medalist.
segments.cn: 或者五届奥运金牌得主。

segments.en: Okay, perfect.
So now it's time for us to go to the mountains with our famous Rick Fields and Bob Copeland and we'll see what happens.
segments.cn: 现在是时候和我们的著名瑞克·菲尔兹和鲍勃·科普兰一起去山上看看会发生什么。

segments.en: Welcome ski lovers of all ages.
segments.cn: 欢迎所有年龄段的滑雪爱好者。

segments.en: My name is Rick Fields and here with me is the man that needs no introduction, Bob Copeland.
segments.cn: 我叫瑞克·菲尔兹，和我在一起的是不需要介绍的鲍勃·科普兰。

segments.en: Thank you, Rick.
What a beautiful day here in Aspen, Colorado where the sun is shining and we've got 12 inches of fresh powder.
segments.cn: 今天在科罗拉多州阿斯彭是个美丽的日子，阳光明媚，我们有12英寸的新鲜粉雪。

segments.en: It doesn't get much better than this.
That's right, Bob.
But today we have a special treat for our viewers.
segments.cn: 但今天我们为观众准备了特别的惊喜。

segments.en: We're joined here by Ian Roussey, four-time giant slalom champion.
segments.cn: 我们请来了四届巨人回转冠军伊恩·鲁西。

segments.en: And on this special edition of the show, Ian is going to teach us the basics of skiing.
segments.cn: 在这个特别版节目中，伊恩将教我们滑雪的基础知识。

segments.en: So let's hit the slopes.
segments.cn: 所以让我们开始滑雪吧。

segments.en: Well, first off, let's get those boots on.
segments.cn: 首先，让我们穿上滑雪靴。

segments.en: You're going to want to make sure your boots fit snugly.
segments.cn: 你要确保你的靴子合脚。

segments.en: That's right.
Now snap them into your bindings.
segments.cn: 现在把它们固定到你的绑定上。

segments.en: And you're also going to want a good pair of goggles to protect your eyes.
segments.cn: 你还需要一副好的护目镜来保护你的眼睛。

segments.en: It's a bright day today so there's going to be a lot of glare out there on the slopes.
segments.cn: 今天是个明亮的日子，所以在滑雪道上会有很多眩光。

segments.en: We don't want you hitting any of those moguls.
segments.cn: 我们不想让你撞到那些小雪丘。

segments.en: Bob, since you're a beginner skier and might take a few spills, it's a good idea to have a good, warm pair of dry ski gloves.
segments.cn: 鲍勃，既然你是初学者，可能会摔倒几次，最好有一副温暖干燥的滑雪手套。

segments.en: Easy there, Rick.
Well, let's head over on to the chairlift and test your skills.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们去滑雪缆车测试你的技能。

segments.en: All right, we're up here on the Johnny Hill.
segments.cn: 好的，我们在约翰尼山上。

segments.en: So, Bob, why don't you do a few snowplow turns.
segments.cn: 所以，鲍勃，为什么不做几个雪犁转弯呢？

segments.en: Gnarly run, Rick.
segments.cn: 真是个刺激的滑道，瑞克。

segments.en: Nice carving.
You've got some mad skills.
That was sick.
You want to see gnarly?
Well, see that bump over there?
segments.cn: 好吧，看到那边的隆起了吗？

segments.en: I'm going to catch some major air.
Butt plant.
He lost his skis.
Yard sale.
Well, thanks for joining us here today.
I think that about does it.
segments.cn: 我想这差不多就到此为止了。

segments.en: Bob, Ian, time for some après-ski.
segments.cn: 鲍勃，伊恩，时间去享受滑雪后的饮料了。

segments.en: No way, man.
We're off to grab some freshies.
segments.cn: 我们要去抓一些新鲜的雪。

segments.en: Pretty embarrassing for Rick there, wasn't it?
segments.cn: 瑞克真是有点尴尬，不是吗？

segments.en: Yeah, he was a little bit cocky and then he ended up falling.
segments.cn: 是的，他有点自负，结果摔倒了。

segments.en: Well, I think there's a lesson in that for all of us.
segments.cn: 我想这对我们所有人来说都是一个教训。

segments.en: But what the real lesson is today is language.
segments.cn: 但今天真正的教训是语言。

segments.en: So, why don't we start with language takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以，我们为什么不开始语言要点呢？

segments.en: Language takeaway.
All right, on language takeaway today, let's take a look at the first word.
segments.cn: 好的，今天的语言要点，我们先来看第一个词。

segments.en: We have some bindings.
Bindings.
Bindings.
Bindings are sort of like a lock that attaches your boot to your ski.
segments.cn: 绑定就像是一个锁，将你的靴子固定在滑雪板上。

segments.en: So, those are the bindings.
I guess it comes from the verb to bind.
Yeah, to tie something so that it stays.
segments.cn: 是的，绑住某样东西使其保持不变。

segments.en: Okay, binding.
So, for example, my bindings are broken.
Okay, and another piece of skiing equipment and very important is goggles.
segments.cn: 好的，另一个滑雪设备非常重要的是护目镜。

segments.en: Goggles.
Okay, we have goggles now.
segments.cn: 好的，我们现在有护目镜了。

segments.en: Yeah, not to be confused with Google.
It's spelled almost the same way, huh?
Yep, but goggles are kind of like... imagine a big pair of glasses that you wear when you ski.
segments.cn: 是的，但护目镜就像...想象一下你滑雪时戴的一副大眼镜。

segments.en: So, it makes people kind of look like flies.
segments.cn: 所以，它让人看起来有点像苍蝇。

segments.en: Yes.
They have these huge glasses.
segments.cn: 他们有这些巨大的眼镜。

segments.en: Yeah, and you'll also see safety goggles which you might wear if you are a mechanic fixing a car or someone working with wood or chemicals or what have you.
segments.cn: 是的，你还会看到安全护目镜，如果你是修车的机械师，或者是做木工、化学工作的人，都会戴。

segments.en: Okay, so goggles basically protect your eyes from snow, from the sun, from anything.
segments.cn: 好的，所以护目镜基本上是保护你的眼睛免受雪、阳光或其他任何东西的伤害。

segments.en: That's right.
All right.
So, moving on to our next ski word.
segments.cn: 那么，接下来我们要讲下一个滑雪词。

segments.en: They said you should wear the goggles so that you don't accidentally go over the moguls.
segments.cn: 他们说你应该戴上护目镜，以免不小心越过小丘。

segments.en: Okay, moguls.
Moguls.
Okay, moguls.
It sounds kind of strange.
What are these things?
Basically, these are the bumps that are in a ski hill.
segments.cn: 基本上，这些是滑雪坡上的小凸起。

segments.en: Bumps.
Okay, so they're kind of like mini little hills.
segments.cn: 好的，所以它们有点像迷你小山丘。

segments.en: Yep.
And they're very difficult to ski over, right?
segments.cn: 而且滑过去非常困难，对吗？

segments.en: That's right.
You got to be pretty good to handle those moguls.
segments.cn: 你必须相当厉害才能应对这些小丘。

segments.en: Okay.
Now, since these guys are beginner skiers, they're starting out on the bunny hill.
segments.cn: 现在，由于这些人是初学者，他们从小坡开始。

segments.en: A bunny hill?
The bunny hill.
Okay, very popular among skiers.
segments.cn: 好的，在滑雪者中非常受欢迎。

segments.en: The bunny hill is the easiest hill.
So, it's where the beginners start to learn.
segments.cn: 所以，这是初学者学习的地方。

segments.en: Yeah, all the kids.
All the kids are on the bunny hill.
segments.cn: 所有的孩子都在小坡上。

segments.en: All right, and our final words.
Actually, we're going to look at two words here because they mean almost exactly the same thing.
segments.cn: 实际上，我们要看两个词，因为它们几乎完全相同。

segments.en: We heard the ski instructors say gnarly.
Gnarly run.
Yeah, gnarly.
So, an interesting word.
segments.cn: 所以，这是一个有趣的词。

segments.en: It's spelled G-N-A-R-L-E-Y.
Okay, so, but you don't say gnarly.
No.
You say gnarly.
Yep.
And a related word, sick.
Okay, now, sick means to be sick, right?
segments.cn: 好的，现在，sick是指生病，对吗？

segments.en: No, no, no, not here.
Let's listen to some examples to help us understand.
segments.cn: 让我们听一些例子来帮助我们理解。

segments.en: Example one.
Those were some sick dance moves.
You are amazing.
Example two.
Jack and I went to the beach yesterday and surfed some really gnarly waves.
segments.cn: 昨天我和杰克去海滩冲浪，冲了一些非常棘手的浪。

segments.en: Example three.
Man, the concert last night was sick.
I can't believe we got front row seats.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信我们坐在前排。

segments.en: Okay, so basically gnarly and sick, they mean that it's amazing.
segments.cn: 好的，所以基本上gnarly和sick的意思是很棒。

segments.en: It was cool.
It's awesome.
Awesome.
Yep.
So these two words are very, very informal.
segments.cn: 所以这两个词非常非常非正式。

segments.en: It's slang.
Yeah, and actually, skier slang.
segments.cn: 是的，实际上是滑雪者的俚语。

segments.en: Both of these words, I think, originated with skiers, snowboarders, skateboarders, gnarly dudes.
segments.cn: 我认为这两个词起源于滑雪者、单板滑雪者、滑板者，棘手的家伙。

segments.en: Gnarly dudes.
Okay, so that's all the words we have for language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们要学习的所有词汇。

segments.en: But we have some great phrases that we want to take a look at before we listen to the dialogue again.
segments.cn: 但在我们再次听对话之前，我们还有一些很棒的短语想要看看。

segments.en: So it's time now for Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在是流利度提升的时间。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
Alright, so Rick said that it is time to...
So Rick invited everyone to start skiing by saying, let's hit the slopes.
segments.cn: 所以瑞克邀请大家开始滑雪，说，让我们去滑雪。

segments.en: Okay, so to hit the slopes.
To hit the slopes.
Okay, now we want to hit the slopes.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们想去滑雪。

segments.en: What does that mean?
Go skiing.
Let's go skiing.
Let's go to the mountain.
Yep.
Now we can change the noun slope for something else, right?
segments.cn: 现在我们可以把名词slope换成其他东西，对吗？

segments.en: Yeah, you can change it for a lot of other different nouns.
segments.cn: 是的，你可以换成很多其他不同的名词。

segments.en: And why don't we hear some examples of how you can do that.
segments.cn: 那么我们来听一些例子，看看你可以怎么做。

segments.en: Example one.
I really have to hit the books and study for my exam tomorrow.
segments.cn: 我真的得去看书，为明天的考试复习。

segments.en: Example two.
I'm really tired.
I think I'm going to hit the bed now.
segments.cn: 我想我现在要去睡觉了。

segments.en: Example three.
Honey, can we hit the supermarket on our way home?
segments.cn: 亲爱的，我们可以在回家的路上去超市吗？

segments.en: I need to buy some milk.
Okay, great.
So great examples and now we understand how we can use the hit the something.
segments.cn: 很好的例子，现在我们明白了如何使用“hit the something”。

segments.en: Alright, what about our next phrase?
segments.cn: 好的，我们下一个短语呢？

segments.en: Well, Rick warned Bob that he might take a few spills.
segments.cn: 好吧，瑞克警告鲍勃他可能会摔倒几次。

segments.en: Okay, so to take a spill.
To take a spill.
Take a spill.
Fall.
To fall.
Yep.
It means like a light fall or... Yeah, pretty dramatic fall.
segments.cn: 这意味着轻微摔倒或... 是的，比较戏剧性的摔倒。

segments.en: Pretty dramatic, so you fell.
segments.cn: 相当戏剧性，所以你摔倒了。

segments.en: Yeah.
So for example, instead of saying that little girl was riding her bike and she fell.
segments.cn: 比如说，不是说那个小女孩骑着自行车摔倒了。

segments.en: I can say that little girl was riding her bike and she took a bad spill.
segments.cn: 我可以说那个小女孩骑着自行车摔了个大跟头。

segments.en: Okay, so to take a spill.
You have to use the verb take though.
Yes, exactly.
You cannot just spill.
Okay, you have to take a spill.
Alright, what about our next phrase?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们下一个短语呢？

segments.en: Well, you might take a spill when you catch some major air.
segments.cn: 嗯，你可能在跳跃时摔倒，抓住一些大空气。

segments.en: Okay, catch some major air.
To catch some major air.
So am I catching something?
How am I catching air?
That's impossible.
Well, imagine if you're jumping and your skis are catching the air.
segments.cn: 嗯，想象一下你在跳跃，你的滑雪板在抓空气。

segments.en: Ah, okay, so I'm in the air for a very long time maybe?
segments.cn: 啊，好的，所以我可能在空中待很长时间？

segments.en: Yeah, when you catch some air, basically it's like you're flying for a couple seconds.
segments.cn: 是的，当你抓住一些空气时，基本上就像你飞了几秒钟。

segments.en: So you're flying for a couple of seconds, you're very high up in the air.
segments.cn: 所以你飞了几秒钟，你在空中很高。

segments.en: Yep.
Okay, to catch some air.

Yeah, and you'll hear this phrase when you're, you know, not only when you're talking about skiing but also maybe if you're, you know, you're driving your car really fast and it sort of jumps up in the air for a minute, well, not a minute, a second.
segments.cn: 是的，你会在谈论滑雪时听到这个短语，但也许如果你开车开得很快，车子跳起来一秒钟，这也是抓空气。

segments.en: That would be catching air as well.
Okay, so to catch air.
Alright, so they finished skiing, they were kind of tired and he said, well, let's call it a day.
segments.cn: 好吧，他们滑雪结束了，有点累，他说，嗯，今天就到此为止。

segments.en: To call it a day.
Let's call it a day.
Let's go home.
Let's go home, it's over.
Let's finish.
Let's finish the day.
Yep.
Let's call it a day and go home.
segments.cn: 今天就到此为止，回家吧。

segments.en: But not before we go to our next word, to grab some freshies.
segments.cn: 但在我们去下一个词之前，去抓一些新鲜的。

segments.en: Alright, grab some freshies.
Grab some freshies.
Okay, freshies.
What are these freshies?
Remember we talked about fresh powder?
segments.cn: 记得我们谈过新鲜的粉雪吗？

segments.en: It's that.
So it's an informal way of saying fresh powder.
segments.cn: 所以这是说新鲜粉雪的一种非正式方式。

segments.en: Yeah, fresh powdery light snow.
Okay, freshies.
Yep, so the snow that nobody has skied on before.
segments.cn: 是的，所以是没人滑过的雪。

segments.en: Really good phrases and some amazing vocabulary.
segments.cn: 很好的短语和一些惊人的词汇。

segments.en: Let's listen to this dialogue one last time and then we'll come back and talk a little bit more about this really fun sport.
segments.cn: 让我们最后再听一遍这个对话，然后我们再回来谈谈这个非常有趣的运动。

segments.en: Welcome ski lovers of all ages.
segments.cn: 欢迎所有年龄段的滑雪爱好者。

segments.en: My name is Rick Fields and here with me is the man that needs no introduction, Bob Copeland.
segments.cn: 我叫Rick Fields，和我在一起的是不需要介绍的人，Bob Copeland。

segments.en: Thank you, Rick.
What a beautiful day here in Aspen, Colorado, where the sun is shining and we've got 12 inches of fresh powder.
segments.cn: 今天在科罗拉多州阿斯彭是个美丽的日子，阳光明媚，我们有12英寸的新鲜粉雪。

segments.en: It doesn't get much better than this.
That's right, Bob.
But today we have a special treat for our viewers.
segments.cn: 但今天我们为观众准备了特别的款待。

segments.en: We're joined here by Ian Russey, four-time giant slalom champion.
segments.cn: 我们请来了四次巨型回转冠军Ian Russey。

segments.en: And on this special edition of the show, Ian is going to teach us the basics of skiing.
segments.cn: 在这个特别版的节目中，Ian将教我们滑雪的基础知识。

segments.en: So let's hit the slopes.
segments.cn: 所以让我们去滑雪道吧。

segments.en: Well, first off, let's get those boots on.
You're going to want to make sure your boots fit snugly.
segments.cn: 你要确保你的靴子合脚。

segments.en: That's right.
Now snap them into your bindings.
segments.cn: 现在把它们扣进你的绑定里。

segments.en: And you're also going to want a good pair of goggles to protect your eyes.
segments.cn: 你还需要一副好的护目镜来保护你的眼睛。

segments.en: It's a bright day today, so there's going to be a lot of glare out there on the slopes.
segments.cn: 今天是个明亮的日子，所以滑雪道上会有很多眩光。

segments.en: We don't want you hitting any of those moguls.
segments.cn: 我们不想让你撞到那些小山包。

segments.en: Bob, since you're a beginner skier and might take a few spills, it's a good idea to have a good warm pair of dry ski gloves.
segments.cn: Bob，既然你是初学者，可能会摔几次，最好有一副温暖干燥的滑雪手套。

segments.en: Easy there, Rick.
Well, let's head over onto the chairlift and test your skills.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们去滑雪缆车测试你的技能。

segments.en: All right, we're up here on the bunny hill.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在小滑雪坡上。

segments.en: So Bob, why don't you do a few snowplow turns?
segments.cn: Bob，为什么不做几次雪犁转弯？

segments.en: Gnarly run, Rick.
Nice carving.
You've got some mad skills.
That was sick.
You want to see gnarly?
Well, see that bump over there?
segments.cn: 好吧，看到那边的隆起了吗？

segments.en: I'm going to catch some major air.
Butt plant.
He lost his skis.
Yard sale.
Well, thanks for joining us here today.
segments.cn: 好吧，感谢你今天的加入。

segments.en: I think that about does it.
segments.cn: 我想这差不多就到此为止了。

segments.en: Bob, Ian, time for some apres ski?
segments.cn: Bob，Ian，去喝点滑雪后的饮料吗？

segments.en: No way, man.
We're off to grab some freshies.
segments.cn: 我们要去抓一些新鲜的。

segments.en: Well, we heard the guys talk about apres ski, and actually this is one of my favorite parts of skiing.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们听到他们谈论滑雪后的饮料，实际上这是我滑雪最喜欢的部分之一。

segments.en: What is this?
It sounds French.
Yeah, it is.
I guess the Frenchness sort of gives it an air of specialness, right?
segments.cn: 我想法语的感觉让它显得特别，对吧？

segments.en: But apres ski is basically the party that you have after you're finished skiing.
segments.cn: 但滑雪后饮料基本上是你滑雪结束后的聚会。

segments.en: So usually you would have parties after skiing.
segments.cn: 所以通常你会在滑雪后举行聚会。

segments.en: Right, so you finish your ski day, you've called it a day, you've glided down those slopes, you head on over to the lodge, you know, the little cabin, grab a beer or two, or maybe some hot alcoholic drink and kick back and relax with your friends.
segments.cn: 对，所以你结束滑雪日，今天就到此为止，你滑下那些滑雪道，去小屋，喝一两杯啤酒，或者一些热的酒精饮料，放松和朋友们一起休息。

segments.en: Wow, so it's popular for families to go to a ski resort and stay there for a couple of days.
segments.cn: 哇，所以家庭去滑雪度假村待几天是很受欢迎的。

segments.en: This is when you would do this with your friends or family.
segments.cn: 这时你会和朋友或家人一起做这个。

segments.en: And you know what, if it's with your friends, it's going to last until late into the night.
segments.cn: 而且你知道，如果是和朋友一起，那会持续到深夜。

segments.en: All right, so it sounds fun.

And next time, maybe if you go skiing with your friends and you guys are speaking English now, you can use all these great phrases and maybe surprise your friends if you tell them, let's go grab some freshies or something like that.
segments.cn: 下次，如果你和朋友一起滑雪，而你们现在在说英语，你可以用这些很棒的短语，可能会让你的朋友惊讶，比如说，咱们去抓点新鲜的东西之类的。

segments.en: Yeah, you'll sound pretty, pretty dialed.
Pretty cool.
All right, so that's all the time we have for today.
Be sure to check out our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 一定要查看我们的网站，EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Marco and I are always around to answer your questions.
segments.cn: 马尔科和我随时可以回答你的问题。

segments.en: And well, thanks for downloading.
Until next time, goodbye.
